page.title: 17Recreation - lake usage.
page.content: Millerground, on the lake shore, is the site of Cumbria County Council's water activities base. Using buildings rented from the National Trust, parties of children from schools and youth groups in south Cumbria are able to make use of canoes and sailing boats at the base. There is only a part-time warden, and staff bringing groups have to have a suitable qualification. This is also the site of the only public swimming area on the lake shore. Elsewhere the bottom shelves steeply and there have been a few accidents every year. The local private girls school also has a boat house and does sailing, wind-surfing and canoeing. Millerground bay has a number of council moorings which are rented (Â£80 per year for a small boat) by both locals and 'offcomers'. Water skiers are often zooming by.
